bibl.title: Sacred and Profane. Treasures of Ancient Egypt from the Myers Collection, Eton College and University of Birmingham.
bibl.note: Catalogue of an exhibition displayed at the Barber Institute of Fine Arts, University of Birmingham from June 2010 to January 2012. - Pp. 87-100, 7 figg.: Michael Sharp, Papyri in Hellenistic and Roman Egypt; - 101-120, 26 figg.: E.G., Economy and Art in Egypt from Alexander the Great to the Arab Conquest.
bibl.seg: Eurydice Goerganteli & Martin Bommas (edd.), Sacred and Profane. Treasures of Ancient Egypt from the Myers Collection, Eton College and University of Birmingham.

London, University of Birmingham, the Provost and Fellows of Eton College (in association with D. Giles Limited, London), 2010, 4°, 116 figg. ISBN 978-1-904832-80-5 (hbk) / 978-0-704427-37-2 (pbk). £22,46 (hbk) / 12,95 (pbk).

Catalogue of an exhibition displayed at the Barber Institute of Fine Arts, University of Birmingham from June 2010 to January 2012. - Pp. 87-100, 7 figg.: Michael Sharp, Papyri in Hellenistic and Roman Egypt; - 101-120, 26 figg.: E.G., Economy and Art in Egypt from Alexander the Great to the Arab Conquest.
